title: So... how does RIot propose to fix this?
body:
I was watching a mate of mine who is new to LOL play co-op the other day and they had this Tahm Kench who would not stop following her around and swallowing her. That is literally all he did the entire game.

She said she didn't want to play and I told her she can't AFK or she would get put into low priority queue.

This isn't right, is it? Why should she be forced to stay in that game?

Please. Serious question. And if there's some avenue I'm not aware of, what is it?

replies.body:
The occasional arsehole doesn't reflect the entirely of the community.

Go watch over replays of worlds for Tahm Kench play, that's why he exists right there.
Wow. Thick. I'm not saying anything about the champ.

Rude. 
The answer is there is no fix, annoying people exist both inside and outside the game, if there was something that could be done to get rid of them from the world it would have been done centuries ago. 

And sure tahm kench lends himself more to trolls than other champs, but like Klavinmour says, his unique strategic gameplay more than makes up for it.

i mean we could all play garen...
and spend the whole game mindlessly running at the enemy and then mindlessly running back, and then mindlessly running at the enemy and then mindlessly running back.
there would be less trolls for sure, but i probably wouldn't be playing either, and nether would you or your friend I'm sure.
You can't really do much about the troll in game but outside of the game or post-game you can just report them and block them and riot will deal with it.
I bloody know what I can and can't do. I was asking whether you think it's fair that we don't have the option to AFK in that situation or similar circumstances.

"Please. Serious question. And if there's some avenue I'm not aware of, what is it?"

then 

"i bloody know what i can and cant do. I was asking whether you think its fair"

Your stories aren't even straight, so you have no grounds to be rude.
sorry lord sesh. put the drugs down.

Yes, it's completely fair as I'm pretty sure right clicking removes you from Tahm. If it didn't, it should. And he also shouldn't be able to ult without warning.

Otherwise, he'll go annoy the other 3 players in the game, and make it less fun for them. I've seen worse and still went through with the game because by staying through one game you've held back a troll, still did some minimal helping and got to report him so he'd have a lesser chance of getting through to the next game to troll others.

And next time, don't ask a question if you won't accept the answers that don't agree with you. 

And don't say "oh but my question is 'This isn't right, is it?'" Because we're answering the question right after that, "Why should she be forced to stay in the game?"
hes baiting buddy... this "she" is clearly himself and he got real mad over a tahm trolling him

yeah thats fucked. its happened to me lol. i thought kalista choosing when to ult someone or bard failing his ult and seriously hindering his team was a troll-y enough mechanic but now they're just giving 12 year old trolls MORE power to feed
No Avenue... just gotta get through the bad to get to the good.
